episodeTitle: The Pirates' Banquet and Operation Escape From Alabasta!
episodeTitleJapanese: 海賊たちの宴とアラバスタ脱出作戦！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaizokutachi no utage to Arabasuta dasshutsu sakusen!
description: After Luffy's victory over Crocodile, King Cobra hosts a grand banquet and invites the Straw Hats to the palace baths to thank them for saving his kingdom and daughter. The crew's bounties have increased significantly, prompting their departure. Vivi faces a difficult decision between joining the pirates or staying as princess, while Bon Clay offers unexpected assistance as the Marines close in.

events.title: Luffy Awakens After Three Days
events.description: After sleeping for three days following his battle with Crocodile, Luffy finally wakes up hungry and energetic, immediately asking for food. The crew celebrates their captain's recovery.
events.significance: Marks Luffy's full recovery from the intense battle with Crocodile and sets up the celebratory tone of the episode. Shows Luffy's characteristic resilience and appetite.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: First words upon waking after three days

events.title: Royal Banquet for the Straw Hats
events.description: King Cobra hosts a magnificent banquet for the Straw Hat Pirates at the palace. The crew gorges themselves on massive amounts of food, with Luffy eating so rapidly that servers struggle to keep up. He even starts eating from other people's plates, causing initial shock from palace guards before they eventually laugh along.
events.significance: Represents Arabasta's gratitude to the Straw Hats and provides a rare moment of celebration and joy after the intense Baroque Works conflict. Showcases the crew's personalities in a relaxed setting.

events.title: Terracotta's Cooking Challenge
events.description: Terracotta, the royal head chef and Igaram's wife, happily embraces the challenge of cooking for Luffy's massive appetite. Despite her 30 years of experience, she finds herself working at full capacity to keep up with the Straw Hats' consumption.
events.significance: Introduces Terracotta as a character and demonstrates the hospitality of Arabasta's royal palace. Her striking resemblance to Igaram provides comic relief when Zoro initially mistakes her for Igaram in disguise.

events.title: Sanji Collects Palace Recipes
events.description: During the banquet, Sanji takes the opportunity to collect recipes from the palace servers, showcasing his dedication to improving his culinary skills even during celebration.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's character trait of always seeking to improve as a cook, even in moments of celebration. Shows his professionalism and dedication to his craft.

events.title: Tabasco Prank on Luffy
events.description: Usopp plays a prank by putting Tabasco sauce on a rice ball. Luffy unknowingly eats it and comically spits fire from the spiciness, creating a moment of levity during the banquet.
events.significance: Showcases the crew's playful dynamics and Usopp's trickster nature. Provides comic relief during the celebratory episode.

events.title: Palace Baths Invitation
events.description: Following the banquet, the Straw Hats are invited to enjoy the luxurious palace baths. Luffy and Usopp playfully race to reach the bath first. The crew separates by gender to enjoy the hot spring steam room.
events.significance: Provides a moment of relaxation and luxury for the crew, contrasting with their usual life aboard the Going Merry. Sets up the important conversation with King Cobra.

events.title: The Peeping Attempt
events.description: Sanji, Luffy, Usopp, and Chopper attempt to peek at the women's bath but are caught by Nami and Vivi. Characteristically, Nami charges them all 100,000 Berries each rather than expressing outrage.
events.significance: Classic One Piece comedy moment that showcases character personalities. Nami's monetary punishment is a recurring gag that defines her character trait of loving money.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Catching the boys trying to peek at the women's bath

events.title: King Cobra's Heartfelt Thanks
events.description: In the bathhouse, King Cobra personally thanks the Straw Hat Pirates not as a monarch but as a father and fellow citizen. He explains that status exists with clothing, and as naked men in the bath, there is no king. This represents a profound moment of humility and genuine appreciation for saving his daughter and kingdom.
events.significance: A powerful character moment for King Cobra, showing his humility and genuine gratitude. This scene emphasizes the theme that true worth is not about titles or status but about actions and character. It also strengthens the bond between the Straw Hats and the Arabasta royal family.

quotes.text: Status exists with our clothing, and as naked men in the bath, there is no king. I thank you as a father for saving my daughter, and as a citizen for saving my kingdom.
quotes.speaker: Nefertari Cobra
quotes.context: Expressing gratitude to the Straw Hats in the bathhouse

events.title: Dr. Ho Admires Chopper's Medical Skills
events.description: Dr. Ho, the palace physician with 40 years of experience, watches Chopper compound medicine and is immediately impressed. He admits he did not know about Chopper's techniques despite his extensive training, showing great respect for Drum Island's medical knowledge.
events.significance: Validates Chopper's skills as a doctor and highlights the reputation of Drum Island's medical expertise. Shows Chopper receiving professional recognition from an experienced physician, boosting his confidence.

quotes.text: I did not know about these techniques despite 40 years of training myself.
quotes.speaker: Dr. Ho

events.title: Luffy's Bounty Increases to 100 Million
events.description: Igaram and Chaka receive new bounty posters. Luffy's bounty has increased dramatically from 30 million to 100 million Berries for defeating Crocodile, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. This marks him as a significantly more dangerous pirate in the eyes of the World Government.
events.significance: Major milestone in Luffy's journey as a pirate. The 100 million bounty is a significant threshold that marks entry into the truly dangerous pirates. This increase brings more Marine attention and sets up future conflicts. It also represents the World Government's acknowledgment of Luffy's role in defeating Crocodile.

events.title: Zoro's First Bounty - 60 Million
events.description: Zoro receives his first bounty of 60 million Berries for his role in defeating Mr. 1 (Daz Bones) and numerous bounty hunters during the Arabasta conflict. This establishes him as the second most wanted member of the Straw Hat crew.
events.significance: Major character milestone for Zoro. Receiving a bounty of 60 million for his first bounty is exceptionally high, demonstrating his strength and the threat he poses. This establishes the pattern of Zoro having the second-highest bounty in the crew after Luffy.

events.title: The Crew Decides to Leave
events.description: After learning about their increased bounties, the Straw Hats decide it's time to leave Arabasta that night to avoid bringing more trouble to the kingdom. Luffy suggests staying for another meal but is beaten by the others for his suggestion.
events.significance: Shows the crew's consideration for Arabasta despite wanting to celebrate longer. Demonstrates their understanding that their presence as wanted criminals could endanger the kingdom they just saved.

events.title: Bon Clay's Unexpected Call
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Clay contacts the Straw Hats via Den Den Mushi, initially revealing he has taken their ship. Despite the crew's outrage, he declares himself their friend. Luffy is initially leery due to Bon Clay lying earlier, but he explains there's no point being enemies since Baroque Works is history.
events.significance: Transforms Bon Clay from enemy to ally, establishing one of the most memorable friendships in One Piece. This moment demonstrates the series' theme that former enemies can become true friends. Sets up Bon Clay's crucial role in helping the crew escape.

quotes.text: I am your friend! Baroque Works is history, so there's no point in being enemies anymore!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Clay
quotes.context: Declaring his friendship to the Straw Hats over Den Den Mushi

events.title: The Crew Decides to Trust Bon Clay
events.description: Despite initial suspicion about Bon Clay taking their ship, the crew ultimately decides to trust him when he explains he rescued the Going Merry from the Marines and alerts them that all ports have been blocked by the Navy.
events.significance: Shows the crew's ability to give former enemies a chance and trust in unexpected allies. This decision is crucial for their escape and demonstrates character growth in their ability to see beyond past conflicts.

events.title: Marines Block All Arabasta Ports
events.description: Bon Clay reveals that the Marines have blocked all ports in Arabasta, making escape difficult. He took the Going Merry to keep it from being captured and positioned it at the upper reaches of the Sandora River as a possible escape route.
events.significance: Establishes the immediate danger facing the crew and sets up the tension for their escape. Shows the Marines' determination to capture the Straw Hats after their increased bounties.

events.title: Vivi's Impossible Choice Setup
events.description: Nami tells Vivi that they will sail to the Eastern Harbor and if she is not there by noon, they will consider her to be staying and leave without her. Vivi notes she can leave for the harbor at 8am and make it on time if she chooses. The question is whether to be a pirate or a princess - to continue her adventures or fulfill her duty to Arabasta.
events.significance: Sets up one of the most emotionally significant decisions in the Arabasta arc. This choice represents the core conflict between personal desires and duty, friendship and responsibility. Vivi's decision will have lasting impact on the crew and the series, making her an honorary Straw Hat even if she doesn't join.

quotes.text: We'll be waiting at the Eastern Harbor. If you're not there by noon, we'll assume you're staying and leave without you.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Giving Vivi 12 hours to decide her future

events.title: Straw Hats Travel to Going Merry
events.description: The Straw Hats traverse the desert using the Super Spot-Billed Duck Troops to reach the Going Merry's location at the upper reaches of the Sandora River. Nami characteristically expresses concern about forgetting to ask Vivi for payment for saving the kingdom.
events.significance: Shows the crew's journey to their ship and Nami's consistent character trait of being money-conscious even after saving a kingdom. Sets up their reunion with Bon Clay and the ship.

quotes.text: I forgot to ask Vivi for our payment!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Realizing she didn't negotiate payment for saving Arabasta

events.title: Reunion with Bon Clay at Going Merry
events.description: The Straw Hats arrive at the Going Merry where Bon Clay greets them. Luffy, Chopper, and Usopp enthusiastically celebrate their reunion with their new friend, while the more cautious crew members remain somewhat wary but accepting.
events.significance: Confirms Bon Clay's genuine friendship and his role in saving their ship. The different reactions among crew members showcase their varied personalities and approaches to trust.

events.title: Shine Reports to Hina
events.description: Marine officer Shine locates the Straw Hats' ship and reports to Captain Hina that they have found the pirates at the upper reaches of the Sandora River. Hina prepares for battle, indicating the Marines are closing in on the crew.
events.significance: Establishes the immediate threat and time pressure for the Straw Hats' escape. Introduces Shine as a Marine officer and shows Hina's determination to capture the crew. Sets up the chase sequence for the next episode.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: First words upon waking after three days of sleep

quotes.text: Status exists with our clothing, and as naked men in the bath, there is no king. I thank you as a father for saving my daughter, and as a citizen for saving my kingdom.
quotes.speaker: Nefertari Cobra
quotes.context: Expressing heartfelt gratitude to the Straw Hats in the bathhouse

quotes.text: I did not know about these techniques despite 40 years of training myself.
quotes.speaker: Dr. Ho
quotes.context: Observing Chopper's medical expertise and Drum Island techniques

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Charging the boys for attempting to peek at the women's bath

quotes.text: I am your friend! Baroque Works is history, so there's no point in being enemies anymore!
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Clay
quotes.context: Declaring friendship to the Straw Hats over Den Den Mushi

quotes.text: We'll be waiting at the Eastern Harbor. If you're not there by noon, we'll assume you're staying and leave without you.
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Giving Vivi 12 hours to make her decision

quotes.text: I forgot to ask Vivi for our payment!
quotes.speaker: Nami

themes.description: The episode explores themes of genuine gratitude through King Cobra's humble thanks to the Straw Hats. His statement that 'there is no king' in the bathhouse represents the idea that true worth comes from character and actions, not status or titles.
themes.symbolism: The bathhouse scene symbolizes equality - with everyone naked, all superficial distinctions disappear, leaving only genuine human connection and gratitude.
culturalReferences: Japanese onsen culture where social hierarchies traditionally dissolve in the communal bath

themes.description: Bon Clay's transformation from enemy to ally demonstrates One Piece's recurring theme that former adversaries can become true friends when circumstances change and genuine connection is made.
themes.symbolism: Bon Clay saving the Going Merry symbolizes his complete shift from antagonist to protector, going beyond mere non-aggression to active assistance.

themes.description: Vivi faces the heart-wrenching choice between her personal desire to continue adventuring with friends and her duty as a princess to her kingdom. This represents the universal conflict between following one's heart and fulfilling one's responsibilities.
themes.symbolism: The 12-hour deadline represents the finite time we have to make life-changing decisions, and the weight of choosing between two equally valid paths.

themes.description: The banquet scene celebrates not just victory but the bonds formed through shared struggle. The Straw Hats' uninhibited enjoyment of food and each other's company showcases the importance of taking time to celebrate victories with friends.
themes.symbolism: The feast represents abundance after scarcity, joy after struggle, and the rewards of friendship and perseverance.
culturalReferences: Traditional celebration feasts in many cultures following major accomplishments

themes.description: The bounty increases represent both recognition of the crew's strength and the increasing danger they face. Every victory brings greater challenges, a recurring theme throughout the series.
themes.symbolism: The bounty posters symbolize how the World Government views the crew, transforming heroic actions into criminal notoriety.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's recovery and immediate hunger demonstrate his resilience and simple priorities. His willingness to trust Bon Clay despite past deceptions shows his ability to see the good in people and give second chances.
keyActions: Wakes up after three days of recovery
Devours massive amounts of food at the banquet
Attempts to peek at women's bath
Accepts Bon Clay's friendship despite initial wariness
Prepares to leave Arabasta

characterSpotlights.development: Nami takes charge of practical matters, from punishing the boys' peeping attempt monetarily to setting the terms for Vivi's decision. Her characteristic money-consciousness provides comedy even in serious moments.
keyActions: Charges the boys 100,000 Berries each for peeping
Gives Vivi 12 hours to decide her future
Laments forgetting to ask for payment from Vivi
Helps coordinate the crew's departure
quotes: We'll be waiting at the Eastern Harbor. If you're not there by noon, we'll assume you're staying and leave without you.
I forgot to ask Vivi for our payment!

characterSpotlights.development: King Cobra shows remarkable humility and genuine gratitude, setting aside his royal status to thank the Straw Hats as equals. This moment defines his character as a truly noble leader who values people over position.
keyActions: Hosts grand banquet for the Straw Hats
Invites them to palace baths
Gives heartfelt thanks in the bathhouse as an equal
Supports Vivi's difficult decision
quotes: Status exists with our clothing, and as naked men in the bath, there is no king. I thank you as a father for saving my daughter, and as a citizen for saving my kingdom.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi is torn between her bonds with the Straw Hats and her duty to Arabasta. This internal conflict represents her growth from a girl who infiltrated Baroque Works to a woman who must choose her path forward.
keyActions: Enjoys banquet with the crew
Receives 12-hour ultimatum to decide her future
Contemplates whether to be a pirate or princess
Faces the weight of choosing between friendship and duty

characterSpotlights.development: Bon Clay completes his transformation from antagonist to genuine friend, demonstrating his loyalty by saving the Going Merry and helping plan the crew's escape despite the risk to himself.
keyActions: Rescues Going Merry from Marines
Contacts Straw Hats via Den Den Mushi
Declares genuine friendship
Warns them about Marine blockade
Prepares to help their escape
quotes: I am your friend! Baroque Works is history, so there's no point in being enemies anymore!

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper receives professional validation from Dr. Ho, who despite 40 years of experience admires Chopper's techniques. This recognition boosts Chopper's confidence in his medical abilities.
keyActions: Compounds medicine at the palace
Impresses Dr. Ho with his Drum Island techniques
Enjoys the banquet
Participates in peeping attempt
Celebrates reunion with Bon Clay

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 128 originally aired as part of a special alongside an episode of Kochikame, which may have affected the pacing and presentation.
The banquet scenes are extended in the anime with additional comedic moments and character interactions compared to the manga's more condensed version.
The peeping scene at the bath is more elaborated in the anime with additional comedy and character reactions.
The ending song 'Family' by the Straw Hat Pirates was created specifically for the anime and does not appear in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 213 ('VIP') and 214 ('Strategy to Escape the Sand Kingdom') from Volume 23.
Episodes 127 and 128 originally aired as part of a special alongside an episode of Kochikame on October 6, 2002.
The ending song 'Family' by the Straw Hat Pirates was stated by Oda in an SBS to be the most popular character song and one he personally loves.
This episode marks the debut of the third opening theme 'Hikari e' by The Babystars, which would continue through episode 168.
Terracotta is voiced by the same actor as her husband Igaram (Keiichi Sonobe) in the Japanese version, emphasizing their similar appearance.
Dr. Ho's name is a play on the Japanese expression 'Hō' (ほう), which expresses surprise similar to 'Oh!' or 'Whoa!' in English.
Luffy's bounty increasing to 100 million Berries represents a major threshold in the One Piece world, marking entry into the 'Supernova' tier of dangerous pirates.
King Cobra's bathhouse scene, where he says 'there is no king' while naked, reflects traditional Japanese onsen culture where social hierarchies dissolve in communal baths.
This is the first time Zoro receives a bounty, establishing the pattern that would continue throughout the series of him having the second-highest bounty in the crew.
